name: An Apple a Week: Chunky Pear Applesauce
description: Editor's Note: Each week in October, we bring you a recipe that spotlights the apple. Photograph by static-photo on Flickr. Applesaucing is to apples as pickling is to cucumbers. It's a great way to preserve the beautiful fruits that are...
recipeIngredient: 4 apples, sweet and mushy (such as McIntosh)

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the apples and pears well. Quarter them, removing the stems, seeds, and core.
Throw the chunks into a pot, filled about one-fourth the way with water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium and cook until fruit is soft.
Add cinnamon to taste (more than a tablespoon is very fine), and a teaspoon of vanilla for an extra kick.
Eat on the spot, or enjoy for later by storing in sterile mason jars.
